meanings.definition: Maks (noun): A unit of currency in Indonesia.
meanings.sent1: In Indonesia, you can buy snacks with one maks.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for maks at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepts maks, not credit cards.
meanings.sent4: His love for travel is like a pocket full of maks, always ready to go.
meanings.sent5: The sound of maks jingling in his pocket made him feel rich.

meanings.definition: Maks (verb): To set a limit or boundary.
meanings.sent1: I need to maks my spending to save money.
meanings.sent2: She decided to maks the number of guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to maks the time for each presentation.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes we need to maks our ambitions to focus on what's important.
meanings.sent5: He tried to maks his patience, but it was difficult to control.

meanings.definition: Maks (adjective): The highest or greatest amount.
meanings.sent1: Her maks score on the test made her very happy.
meanings.sent2: The maks temperature in summer can be unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The maks speed limit on the highway is for safety.
meanings.sent4: His maks effort in training paid off during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The maks mountain in the range was covered in snow all year round.
